intro: Rottlera operiana, commonly known as the Indian rosewood, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits.
